47/*
48 * Task manager is built around 'as little locking as possible' concept.
49 * Each thread has his own queue of tasks to be run, if a task is in running
50 * state it will stay on the runner it's currently on, if a task is in idle
51 * state it can be woken up on a specific runner with isc_task_sendto - that
52 * helps with data locality on CPU.
53 *
54 * To make load even some tasks (from task pools) are bound to specific
55 * queues using isc_task_create_bound. This way load balancing between
56 * CPUs/queues happens on the higher layer.
57 */
58
59#ifdef ISC_TASK_TRACE
60#define XTRACE(m) fprintf(stderr, "task %p thread %lu: %s\n", \
61 task, isc_thread_self(), (m))
62#define XTTRACE(t, m) fprintf(stderr, "task %p thread %lu: %s\n", \
63 (t), isc_thread_self(), (m))
64#define XTHREADTRACE(m) fprintf(stderr, "thread %lu: %s\n", \
65 isc_thread_self(), (m))
66#else
67#define XTRACE(m)
68#define XTTRACE(t, m)
69#define XTHREADTRACE(m)
70#endif
71
72/***
73 *** Types.
74 ***/
75
76typedef enum {
77 task_state_idle, task_state_ready, task_state_running,
78 task_state_done
79} task_state_t;
80
81#if defined(HAVE_LIBXML2) || defined(HAVE_JSON)
82static const char *statenames[] = {
83 "idle", "ready", "running", "done",
84};
85#endif
86
87#define TASK_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('T', 'A', 'S', 'K')
88#define VALID_TASK(t) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(t, TASK_MAGIC)
89
90typedef struct isc__task isc__task_t;
91typedef struct isc__taskmgr isc__taskmgr_t;
92typedef struct isc__taskqueue isc__taskqueue_t;
93
94struct isc__task {
95 /* Not locked. */
96 isc_task_t common;
97 isc__taskmgr_t * manager;
98 isc_mutex_t lock;
99 /* Locked by task lock. */
100 task_state_t state;
101 unsigned int references;
102 isc_eventlist_t events;
103 isc_eventlist_t on_shutdown;
104 unsigned int nevents;
105 unsigned int quantum;
106 unsigned int flags;
107 isc_stdtime_t now;
108 isc_time_t tnow;
109 char name[16];
110 void * tag;
111 unsigned int threadid;
112 bool bound;
113 /* Locked by task manager lock. */
114 LINK(isc__task_t) link;
115 LINK(isc__task_t) ready_link;
116 LINK(isc__task_t) ready_priority_link;
117};
118
119#define TASK_F_SHUTTINGDOWN 0x01
120#define TASK_F_PRIVILEGED 0x02
121
122#define TASK_SHUTTINGDOWN(t) (((t)->flags & TASK_F_SHUTTINGDOWN) \
123 != 0)
124
125#define TASK_MANAGER_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('T', 'S', 'K', 'M')
126#define VALID_MANAGER(m) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(m, TASK_MANAGER_MAGIC)
127
128typedef ISC_LIST(isc__task_t) isc__tasklist_t;
129
130struct isc__taskqueue {
131 /* Everything locked by lock */
132 isc_mutex_t lock;
133 isc__tasklist_t ready_tasks;
134 isc__tasklist_t ready_priority_tasks;
135 isc_condition_t work_available;
136 isc_thread_t thread;
137 unsigned int threadid;
138 isc__taskmgr_t *manager;
139};
140
141struct isc__taskmgr {
142 /* Not locked. */
143 isc_taskmgr_t common;
144 isc_mem_t * mctx;
145 isc_mutex_t lock;
146 isc_mutex_t halt_lock;
147 isc_condition_t halt_cond;
148 unsigned int workers;
149 atomic_uint_fast32_t tasks_running;
150 atomic_uint_fast32_t tasks_ready;
151 atomic_uint_fast32_t curq;
152 atomic_uint_fast32_t tasks_count;
153 isc__taskqueue_t *queues;
154
155 /* Locked by task manager lock. */
156 unsigned int default_quantum;
157 LIST(isc__task_t) tasks;
158 atomic_uint_fast32_t mode;
159 atomic_bool pause_req;
160 atomic_bool exclusive_req;
161 atomic_bool exiting;
162
163 /* Locked by halt_lock */
164 unsigned int halted;
165
166 /*
167 * Multiple threads can read/write 'excl' at the same time, so we need
168 * to protect the access. We can't use 'lock' since isc_task_detach()
169 * will try to acquire it.
170 */
171 isc_mutex_t excl_lock;
172 isc__task_t *excl;
173};
174
175void
176isc__taskmgr_pause(isc_taskmgr_t *manager0);
177void
178isc__taskmgr_resume(isc_taskmgr_t *manager0);
179
180
181#define DEFAULT_DEFAULT_QUANTUM 25
182#define FINISHED(m) (atomic_load_relaxed(&((m)->exiting)) == true && \
183 atomic_load(&(m)->tasks_count) == 0)
184
185/*%
186 * The following are intended for internal use (indicated by "isc__"
187 * prefix) but are not declared as static, allowing direct access from
188 * unit tests etc.
189 */
190
191bool
192isc_task_purgeevent(isc_task_t *task0, isc_event_t *event);
193void
194isc_taskmgr_setexcltask(isc_taskmgr_t *mgr0, isc_task_t *task0);
195isc_result_t
196isc_taskmgr_excltask(isc_taskmgr_t *mgr0, isc_task_t **taskp);
197static inline bool
198empty_readyq(isc__taskmgr_t *manager, int c);
199
200static inline isc__task_t *
201pop_readyq(isc__taskmgr_t *manager, int c);
202
203static inline void
204push_readyq(isc__taskmgr_t *manager, isc__task_t *task, int c);
205
206static inline void
207wake_all_queues(isc__taskmgr_t *manager);
208
209/***
210 *** Tasks.
211 ***/
212
213static inline void
214wake_all_queues(isc__taskmgr_t *manager) {
215 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < manager->workers; i++) {
216 LOCK(&manager->queues[i].lock);
217 BROADCAST(&manager->queues[i].work_available);
218 UNLOCK(&manager->queues[i].lock);
219 }
220}
221
222static void
223task_finished(isc__task_t *task) {
224 isc__taskmgr_t *manager = task->manager;
225 REQUIRE(EMPTY(task->events));
226 REQUIRE(task->nevents == 0);
227 REQUIRE(EMPTY(task->on_shutdown));
228 REQUIRE(task->references == 0);
229 REQUIRE(task->state == task_state_done);
230
231 XTRACE("task_finished");
232
233 LOCK(&manager->lock);
234 UNLINK(manager->tasks, task, link);
235 atomic_fetch_sub(&manager->tasks_count, 1);
236 UNLOCK(&manager->lock);
237 if (FINISHED(manager)) {
238 /*
239 * All tasks have completed and the
240 * task manager is exiting. Wake up
241 * any idle worker threads so they
242 * can exit.
243 */
244 wake_all_queues(manager);
245 }
246 isc_mutex_destroy(&task->lock);
247 task->common.impmagic = 0;
248 task->common.magic = 0;
249 isc_mem_put(manager->mctx, task, sizeof(*task));
250}
251
252isc_result_t
253isc_task_create(isc_taskmgr_t *manager0, unsigned int quantum,
254 isc_task_t **taskp)
255{
256 return (isc_task_create_bound(manager0, quantum, taskp, -1));
257}
258
259isc_result_t
260isc_task_create_bound(isc_taskmgr_t *manager0, unsigned int quantum,
261 isc_task_t **taskp, int threadid)
262{
263 isc__taskmgr_t *manager = (isc__taskmgr_t *)manager0;
264 isc__task_t *task;
265 bool exiting;
266
267 REQUIRE(VALID_MANAGER(manager));
268 REQUIRE(taskp != NULL && *taskp == NULL);
269
270 task = isc_mem_get(manager->mctx, sizeof(*task));
271 if (task == NULL)
272 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
273 XTRACE("isc_task_create");
274 task->manager = manager;
275
276 if (threadid == -1) {
277 /*
278 * Task is not pinned to a queue, it's threadid will be
279 * choosen when first task will be sent to it - either
280 * randomly or specified by isc_task_sendto.
281 */
282 task->bound = false;
283 task->threadid = 0;
284 } else {
285 /*
286 * Task is pinned to a queue, it'll always be run
287 * by a specific thread.
288 */
289 task->bound = true;
290 task->threadid = threadid % manager->workers;
291 }
292
293 isc_mutex_init(&task->lock);
294 task->state = task_state_idle;
295 task->references = 1;
296 INIT_LIST(task->events);
297 INIT_LIST(task->on_shutdown);
298 task->nevents = 0;
299 task->quantum = (quantum > 0) ? quantum : manager->default_quantum;
300 task->flags = 0;
301 task->now = 0;
302 isc_time_settoepoch(&task->tnow);
303 memset(task->name, 0, sizeof(task->name));
304 task->tag = NULL;
305 INIT_LINK(task, link);
306 INIT_LINK(task, ready_link);
307 INIT_LINK(task, ready_priority_link);
308
309 exiting = false;
310 LOCK(&manager->lock);
311 if (!atomic_load_relaxed(&manager->exiting)) {
312 APPEND(manager->tasks, task, link);
313 atomic_fetch_add(&manager->tasks_count, 1);
314 } else {
315 exiting = true;
316 }
317 UNLOCK(&manager->lock);
318
319 if (exiting) {
320 isc_mutex_destroy(&task->lock);
321 isc_mem_put(manager->mctx, task, sizeof(*task));
322 return (ISC_R_SHUTTINGDOWN);
323 }
324
325 task->common.magic = ISCAPI_TASK_MAGIC;
326 task->common.impmagic = TASK_MAGIC;
327 *taskp = (isc_task_t *)task;
328
329 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
330}
331
332void
333isc_task_attach(isc_task_t *source0, isc_task_t **targetp) {
334 isc__task_t *source = (isc__task_t *)source0;
335
336 /*
337 * Attach *targetp to source.
338 */
339
340 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(source));
341 REQUIRE(targetp != NULL && *targetp == NULL);
342
343 XTTRACE(source, "isc_task_attach");
344
345 LOCK(&source->lock);
346 source->references++;
347 UNLOCK(&source->lock);
348
349 *targetp = (isc_task_t *)source;
350}
351
352static inline bool
353task_shutdown(isc__task_t *task) {
354 bool was_idle = false;
355 isc_event_t *event, *prev;
356
357 /*
358 * Caller must be holding the task's lock.
359 */
360
361 XTRACE("task_shutdown");
362
363 if (! TASK_SHUTTINGDOWN(task)) {
364 XTRACE("shutting down");
365 task->flags |= TASK_F_SHUTTINGDOWN;
366 if (task->state == task_state_idle) {
367 INSIST(EMPTY(task->events));
368 task->state = task_state_ready;
369 was_idle = true;
370 }
371 INSIST(task->state == task_state_ready ||
372 task->state == task_state_running);
373
374 /*
375 * Note that we post shutdown events LIFO.
376 */
377 for (event = TAIL(task->on_shutdown);
378 event != NULL;
379 event = prev) {
380 prev = PREV(event, ev_link);
381 DEQUEUE(task->on_shutdown, event, ev_link);
382 ENQUEUE(task->events, event, ev_link);
383 task->nevents++;
384 }
385 }
386
387 return (was_idle);
388}
389
390/*
391 * Moves a task onto the appropriate run queue.
392 *
393 * Caller must NOT hold manager lock.
394 */
395static inline void
396task_ready(isc__task_t *task) {
397 isc__taskmgr_t *manager = task->manager;
398 bool has_privilege = isc_task_privilege((isc_task_t *) task);
399
400 REQUIRE(VALID_MANAGER(manager));
401 REQUIRE(task->state == task_state_ready);
402
403 XTRACE("task_ready");
404 LOCK(&manager->queues[task->threadid].lock);
405 push_readyq(manager, task, task->threadid);
406 if (atomic_load(&manager->mode) == isc_taskmgrmode_normal ||
407 has_privilege) {
408 SIGNAL(&manager->queues[task->threadid].work_available);
409 }
410 UNLOCK(&manager->queues[task->threadid].lock);
411}
412
413static inline bool
414task_detach(isc__task_t *task) {
415
416 /*
417 * Caller must be holding the task lock.
418 */
419
420 REQUIRE(task->references > 0);
421
422 XTRACE("detach");
423
424 task->references--;
425 if (task->references == 0 && task->state == task_state_idle) {
426 INSIST(EMPTY(task->events));
427 /*
428 * There are no references to this task, and no
429 * pending events. We could try to optimize and
430 * either initiate shutdown or clean up the task,
431 * depending on its state, but it's easier to just
432 * make the task ready and allow run() or the event
433 * loop to deal with shutting down and termination.
434 */
435 task->state = task_state_ready;
436 return (true);
437 }
438
439 return (false);
440}
441
442void
443isc_task_detach(isc_task_t **taskp) {
444 isc__task_t *task;
445 bool was_idle;
446
447 /*
448 * Detach *taskp from its task.
449 */
450
451 REQUIRE(taskp != NULL);
452 task = (isc__task_t *)*taskp;
453 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(task));
454
455 XTRACE("isc_task_detach");
456
457 LOCK(&task->lock);
458 was_idle = task_detach(task);
459 UNLOCK(&task->lock);
460
461 if (was_idle)
462 task_ready(task);
463
464 *taskp = NULL;
465}
466
467static inline bool
468task_send(isc__task_t *task, isc_event_t **eventp, int c) {
469 bool was_idle = false;
470 isc_event_t *event;
471
472 /*
473 * Caller must be holding the task lock.
474 */
475
476 REQUIRE(eventp != NULL);
477 event = *eventp;
478 REQUIRE(event != NULL);
479 REQUIRE(event->ev_type > 0);
480 REQUIRE(task->state != task_state_done);
481 REQUIRE(!ISC_LINK_LINKED(event, ev_ratelink));
482
483 XTRACE("task_send");
484
485 if (task->state == task_state_idle) {
486 was_idle = true;
487 task->threadid = c;
488 INSIST(EMPTY(task->events));
489 task->state = task_state_ready;
490 }
491 INSIST(task->state == task_state_ready ||
492 task->state == task_state_running);
493 ENQUEUE(task->events, event, ev_link);
494 task->nevents++;
495 *eventp = NULL;
496
497 return (was_idle);
498}
499
500void
501isc_task_send(isc_task_t *task0, isc_event_t **eventp) {
502 isc_task_sendto(task0, eventp, -1);
503}
504
505void
506isc_task_sendanddetach(isc_task_t **taskp, isc_event_t **eventp) {
507 isc_task_sendtoanddetach(taskp, eventp, -1);
508}
509
510void
511isc_task_sendto(isc_task_t *task0, isc_event_t **eventp, int c) {
512 isc__task_t *task = (isc__task_t *)task0;
513 bool was_idle;
514
515 /*
516 * Send '*event' to 'task'.
517 */
518
519 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(task));
520 XTRACE("isc_task_send");
521
522
523 /*
524 * We're trying hard to hold locks for as short a time as possible.
525 * We're also trying to hold as few locks as possible. This is why
526 * some processing is deferred until after the lock is released.
527 */
528 LOCK(&task->lock);
529 /* If task is bound ignore provided cpu. */
530 if (task->bound) {
531 c = task->threadid;
532 } else if (c < 0) {
533 c = atomic_fetch_add_explicit(&task->manager->curq, 1,
534 memory_order_relaxed);
535 }
536 c %= task->manager->workers;
537 was_idle = task_send(task, eventp, c);
538 UNLOCK(&task->lock);
539
540 if (was_idle) {
541 /*
542 * We need to add this task to the ready queue.
543 *
544 * We've waited until now to do it because making a task
545 * ready requires locking the manager. If we tried to do
546 * this while holding the task lock, we could deadlock.
547 *
548 * We've changed the state to ready, so no one else will
549 * be trying to add this task to the ready queue. The
550 * only way to leave the ready state is by executing the
551 * task. It thus doesn't matter if events are added,
552 * removed, or a shutdown is started in the interval
553 * between the time we released the task lock, and the time
554 * we add the task to the ready queue.
555 */
556 task_ready(task);
557 }
558}
559
560void
561isc_task_sendtoanddetach(isc_task_t **taskp, isc_event_t **eventp, int c) {
562 bool idle1, idle2;
563 isc__task_t *task;
564
565 /*
566 * Send '*event' to '*taskp' and then detach '*taskp' from its
567 * task.
568 */
569
570 REQUIRE(taskp != NULL);
571 task = (isc__task_t *)*taskp;
572 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(task));
573 XTRACE("isc_task_sendanddetach");
574
575 LOCK(&task->lock);
576 if (task->bound) {
577 c = task->threadid;
578 } else if (c < 0) {
579 c = atomic_fetch_add_explicit(&task->manager->curq, 1,
580 memory_order_relaxed);
581 }
582 c %= task->manager->workers;
583 idle1 = task_send(task, eventp, c);
584 idle2 = task_detach(task);
585 UNLOCK(&task->lock);
586
587 /*
588 * If idle1, then idle2 shouldn't be true as well since we're holding
589 * the task lock, and thus the task cannot switch from ready back to
590 * idle.
591 */
592 INSIST(!(idle1 && idle2));
593
594 if (idle1 || idle2)
595 task_ready(task);
596
597 *taskp = NULL;
598}
599
600#define PURGE_OK(event) (((event)->ev_attributes & ISC_EVENTATTR_NOPURGE) == 0)
601
602static unsigned int
603dequeue_events(isc__task_t *task, void *sender, isc_eventtype_t first,
604 isc_eventtype_t last, void *tag,
605 isc_eventlist_t *events, bool purging)
606{
607 isc_event_t *event, *next_event;
608 unsigned int count = 0;
609
610 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(task));
611 REQUIRE(last >= first);
612
613 XTRACE("dequeue_events");
614
615 /*
616 * Events matching 'sender', whose type is >= first and <= last, and
617 * whose tag is 'tag' will be dequeued. If 'purging', matching events
618 * which are marked as unpurgable will not be dequeued.
619 *
620 * sender == NULL means "any sender", and tag == NULL means "any tag".
621 */
622
623 LOCK(&task->lock);
624
625 for (event = HEAD(task->events); event != NULL; event = next_event) {
626 next_event = NEXT(event, ev_link);
627 if (event->ev_type >= first && event->ev_type <= last &&
628 (sender == NULL || event->ev_sender == sender) &&
629 (tag == NULL || event->ev_tag == tag) &&
630 (!purging || PURGE_OK(event))) {
631 DEQUEUE(task->events, event, ev_link);
632 task->nevents--;
633 ENQUEUE(*events, event, ev_link);
634 count++;
635 }
636 }
637
638 UNLOCK(&task->lock);
639
640 return (count);
641}
642
643unsigned int
644isc_task_purgerange(isc_task_t *task0, void *sender, isc_eventtype_t first,
645 isc_eventtype_t last, void *tag)
646{
647 isc__task_t *task = (isc__task_t *)task0;
648 unsigned int count;
649 isc_eventlist_t events;
650 isc_event_t *event, *next_event;
651 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(task));
652
653 /*
654 * Purge events from a task's event queue.
655 */
656
657 XTRACE("isc_task_purgerange");
658
659 ISC_LIST_INIT(events);
660
661 count = dequeue_events(task, sender, first, last, tag, &events,
662 true);
663
664 for (event = HEAD(events); event != NULL; event = next_event) {
665 next_event = NEXT(event, ev_link);
666 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(events, event, ev_link);
667 isc_event_free(&event);
668 }
669
670 /*
671 * Note that purging never changes the state of the task.
672 */
673
674 return (count);
675}
676
677unsigned int
678isc_task_purge(isc_task_t *task, void *sender, isc_eventtype_t type,
679 void *tag)
680{
681 /*
682 * Purge events from a task's event queue.
683 */
684 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(task));
685
686 XTRACE("isc_task_purge");
687
688 return (isc_task_purgerange(task, sender, type, type, tag));
689}
690
691bool
692isc_task_purgeevent(isc_task_t *task0, isc_event_t *event) {
693 isc__task_t *task = (isc__task_t *)task0;
694 isc_event_t *curr_event, *next_event;
695
696 /*
697 * Purge 'event' from a task's event queue.
698 *
699 * XXXRTH: WARNING: This method may be removed before beta.
700 */
701
702 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(task));
703
704 /*
705 * If 'event' is on the task's event queue, it will be purged,
706 * unless it is marked as unpurgeable. 'event' does not have to be
707 * on the task's event queue; in fact, it can even be an invalid
708 * pointer. Purging only occurs if the event is actually on the task's
709 * event queue.
710 *
711 * Purging never changes the state of the task.
712 */
713
714 LOCK(&task->lock);
715 for (curr_event = HEAD(task->events);
716 curr_event != NULL;
717 curr_event = next_event) {
718 next_event = NEXT(curr_event, ev_link);
719 if (curr_event == event && PURGE_OK(event)) {
720 DEQUEUE(task->events, curr_event, ev_link);
721 task->nevents--;
722 break;
723 }
724 }
725 UNLOCK(&task->lock);
726
727 if (curr_event == NULL)
728 return (false);
729
730 isc_event_free(&curr_event);
731
732 return (true);
733}
734
735unsigned int
736isc_task_unsendrange(isc_task_t *task, void *sender, isc_eventtype_t first,
737 isc_eventtype_t last, void *tag,
738 isc_eventlist_t *events)
739{
740 /*
741 * Remove events from a task's event queue.
742 */
743 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(task));
744
745 XTRACE("isc_task_unsendrange");
746
747 return (dequeue_events((isc__task_t *)task, sender, first,
748 last, tag, events, false));
749}
750
751unsigned int
752isc_task_unsend(isc_task_t *task, void *sender, isc_eventtype_t type,
753 void *tag, isc_eventlist_t *events)
754{
755 /*
756 * Remove events from a task's event queue.
757 */
758
759 XTRACE("isc_task_unsend");
760
761 return (dequeue_events((isc__task_t *)task, sender, type,
762 type, tag, events, false));
763}
764
765isc_result_t
766isc_task_onshutdown(isc_task_t *task0, isc_taskaction_t action,
767 void *arg)
768{
769 isc__task_t *task = (isc__task_t *)task0;
770 bool disallowed = false;
771 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
772 isc_event_t *event;
773
774 /*
775 * Send a shutdown event with action 'action' and argument 'arg' when
776 * 'task' is shutdown.
777 */
778
779 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(task));
780 REQUIRE(action != NULL);
781
782 event = isc_event_allocate(task->manager->mctx,
783 NULL,
784 ISC_TASKEVENT_SHUTDOWN,
785 action,
786 arg,
787 sizeof(*event));
788 if (event == NULL)
789 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
790
791 LOCK(&task->lock);
792 if (TASK_SHUTTINGDOWN(task)) {
793 disallowed = true;
794 result = ISC_R_SHUTTINGDOWN;
795 } else
796 ENQUEUE(task->on_shutdown, event, ev_link);
797 UNLOCK(&task->lock);
798
799 if (disallowed)
800 isc_mem_put(task->manager->mctx, event, sizeof(*event));
801
802 return (result);
803}
804
805void
806isc_task_shutdown(isc_task_t *task0) {
807 isc__task_t *task = (isc__task_t *)task0;
808 bool was_idle;
809
810 /*
811 * Shutdown 'task'.
812 */
813
814 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(task));
815
816 LOCK(&task->lock);
817 was_idle = task_shutdown(task);
818 UNLOCK(&task->lock);
819
820 if (was_idle)
821 task_ready(task);
822}
823
824void
825isc_task_destroy(isc_task_t **taskp) {
826
827 /*
828 * Destroy '*taskp'.
829 */
830
831 REQUIRE(taskp != NULL);
832
833 isc_task_shutdown(*taskp);
834 isc_task_detach(taskp);
835}
836
837void
838isc_task_setname(isc_task_t *task0, const char *name, void *tag) {
839 isc__task_t *task = (isc__task_t *)task0;
840
841 /*
842 * Name 'task'.
843 */
844
845 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(task));
846
847 LOCK(&task->lock);
848 strlcpy(task->name, name, sizeof(task->name));
849 task->tag = tag;
850 UNLOCK(&task->lock);
851}
852
853
854const char *
855isc_task_getname(isc_task_t *task0) {
856 isc__task_t *task = (isc__task_t *)task0;
857
858 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(task));
859
860 return (task->name);
861}
862
863void *
864isc_task_gettag(isc_task_t *task0) {
865 isc__task_t *task = (isc__task_t *)task0;
866
867 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(task));
868
869 return (task->tag);
870}
871
872void
873isc_task_getcurrenttime(isc_task_t *task0, isc_stdtime_t *t) {
874 isc__task_t *task = (isc__task_t *)task0;
875
876 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(task));
877 REQUIRE(t != NULL);
878
879 LOCK(&task->lock);
880 *t = task->now;
881 UNLOCK(&task->lock);
882}
883
884void
885isc_task_getcurrenttimex(isc_task_t *task0, isc_time_t *t) {
886 isc__task_t *task = (isc__task_t *)task0;
887
888 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(task));
889 REQUIRE(t != NULL);
890
891 LOCK(&task->lock);
892 *t = task->tnow;
893 UNLOCK(&task->lock);
894}
895
896/***
897 *** Task Manager.
898 ***/
899
900/*
901 * Return true if the current ready list for the manager, which is
902 * either ready_tasks or the ready_priority_tasks, depending on whether
903 * the manager is currently in normal or privileged execution mode.
904 *
905 * Caller must hold the task manager lock.
906 */
907static inline bool
908empty_readyq(isc__taskmgr_t *manager, int c) {
909 isc__tasklist_t queue;
910
911 if (atomic_load_relaxed(&manager->mode) == isc_taskmgrmode_normal) {
912 queue = manager->queues[c].ready_tasks;
913 } else {
914 queue = manager->queues[c].ready_priority_tasks;
915 }
916 return (EMPTY(queue));
917}
918
919/*
920 * Dequeue and return a pointer to the first task on the current ready
921 * list for the manager.
922 * If the task is privileged, dequeue it from the other ready list
923 * as well.
924 *
925 * Caller must hold the task manager lock.
926 */
927static inline isc__task_t *
928pop_readyq(isc__taskmgr_t *manager, int c) {
929 isc__task_t *task;
930
931 if (atomic_load_relaxed(&manager->mode) == isc_taskmgrmode_normal) {
932 task = HEAD(manager->queues[c].ready_tasks);
933 } else {
934 task = HEAD(manager->queues[c].ready_priority_tasks);
935 }
936
937 if (task != NULL) {
938 DEQUEUE(manager->queues[c].ready_tasks, task, ready_link);
939 if (ISC_LINK_LINKED(task, ready_priority_link)) {
940 DEQUEUE(manager->queues[c].ready_priority_tasks, task,
941 ready_priority_link);
942 }
943 }
944
945 return (task);
946}
947
948/*
949 * Push 'task' onto the ready_tasks queue. If 'task' has the privilege
950 * flag set, then also push it onto the ready_priority_tasks queue.
951 *
952 * Caller must hold the task manager lock.
953 */
954static inline void
955push_readyq(isc__taskmgr_t *manager, isc__task_t *task, int c) {
956 ENQUEUE(manager->queues[c].ready_tasks, task, ready_link);
957 if ((task->flags & TASK_F_PRIVILEGED) != 0) {
958 ENQUEUE(manager->queues[c].ready_priority_tasks, task,
959 ready_priority_link);
960 }
961 atomic_fetch_add_explicit(&manager->tasks_ready, 1,
962 memory_order_acquire);
963}
964
965static void
966dispatch(isc__taskmgr_t *manager, unsigned int threadid) {
967 isc__task_t *task;
968
969 REQUIRE(VALID_MANAGER(manager));
970
971 /* Wait for everything to initialize */
972 LOCK(&manager->lock);
973 UNLOCK(&manager->lock);
974
975 /*
976 * Again we're trying to hold the lock for as short a time as possible
977 * and to do as little locking and unlocking as possible.
978 *
979 * In both while loops, the appropriate lock must be held before the
980 * while body starts. Code which acquired the lock at the top of
981 * the loop would be more readable, but would result in a lot of
982 * extra locking. Compare:
983 *
984 * Straightforward:
985 *
986 * LOCK();
987 * ...
988 * UNLOCK();
989 * while (expression) {
990 * LOCK();
991 * ...
992 * UNLOCK();
993 *
994 * Unlocked part here...
995 *
996 * LOCK();
997 * ...
998 * UNLOCK();
999 * }
1000 *
1001 * Note how if the loop continues we unlock and then immediately lock.
1002 * For N iterations of the loop, this code does 2N+1 locks and 2N+1
1003 * unlocks. Also note that the lock is not held when the while
1004 * condition is tested, which may or may not be important, depending
1005 * on the expression.
1006 *
1007 * As written:
1008 *
1009 * LOCK();
1010 * while (expression) {
1011 * ...
1012 * UNLOCK();
1013 *
1014 * Unlocked part here...
1015 *
1016 * LOCK();
1017 * ...
1018 * }
1019 * UNLOCK();
1020 *
1021 * For N iterations of the loop, this code does N+1 locks and N+1
1022 * unlocks. The while expression is always protected by the lock.
1023 */
1024 LOCK(&manager->queues[threadid].lock);
1025
1026 while (!FINISHED(manager)) {
1027 /*
1028 * For reasons similar to those given in the comment in
1029 * isc_task_send() above, it is safe for us to dequeue
1030 * the task while only holding the manager lock, and then
1031 * change the task to running state while only holding the
1032 * task lock.
1033 *
1034 * If a pause has been requested, don't do any work
1035 * until it's been released.
1036 */
1037 while ((empty_readyq(manager, threadid) &&
1038 !atomic_load_relaxed(&manager->pause_req) &&
1039 !atomic_load_relaxed(&manager->exclusive_req)) &&
1040 !FINISHED(manager))
1041 {
1042 XTHREADTRACE("wait");
1043 XTHREADTRACE(atomic_load_relaxed(&manager->pause_req)
1044 ? "paused"
1045 : "notpaused");
1046 XTHREADTRACE(atomic_load_relaxed(&manager->exclusive_req)
1047 ? "excreq"
1048 : "notexcreq");
1049 WAIT(&manager->queues[threadid].work_available,
1050 &manager->queues[threadid].lock);
1051 XTHREADTRACE("awake");
1052 }
1053 XTHREADTRACE("working");
1054
1055 if (atomic_load_relaxed(&manager->pause_req) ||
1056 atomic_load_relaxed(&manager->exclusive_req)) {
1057 UNLOCK(&manager->queues[threadid].lock);
1058 XTHREADTRACE("halting");
1059
1060 /*
1061 * Switching to exclusive mode is done as a
1062 * 2-phase-lock, checking if we have to switch is
1063 * done without any locks on pause_req and
1064 * exclusive_req to save time - the worst
1065 * thing that can happen is that we'll launch one
1066 * task more and exclusive task will be postponed a
1067 * bit.
1068 *
1069 * Broadcasting on halt_cond seems suboptimal, but
1070 * exclusive tasks are rare enought that we don't
1071 * care.
1072 */
1073 LOCK(&manager->halt_lock);
1074 manager->halted++;
1075 BROADCAST(&manager->halt_cond);
1076 while (atomic_load_relaxed(&manager->pause_req) ||
1077 atomic_load_relaxed(&manager->exclusive_req))
1078 {
1079 WAIT(&manager->halt_cond, &manager->halt_lock);
1080 }
1081 manager->halted--;
1082 SIGNAL(&manager->halt_cond);
1083 UNLOCK(&manager->halt_lock);
1084
1085 LOCK(&manager->queues[threadid].lock);
1086 /* Restart the loop after */
1087 continue;
1088 }
1089
1090 task = pop_readyq(manager, threadid);
1091 if (task != NULL) {
1092 unsigned int dispatch_count = 0;
1093 bool done = false;
1094 bool requeue = false;
1095 bool finished = false;
1096 isc_event_t *event;
1097
1098 INSIST(VALID_TASK(task));
1099
1100 /*
1101 * Note we only unlock the queue lock if we actually
1102 * have a task to do. We must reacquire the queue
1103 * lock before exiting the 'if (task != NULL)' block.
1104 */
1105 UNLOCK(&manager->queues[threadid].lock);
1106 RUNTIME_CHECK(
1107 atomic_fetch_sub_explicit(&manager->tasks_ready,
1108 1, memory_order_release) > 0);
1109 atomic_fetch_add_explicit(&manager->tasks_running, 1,
1110 memory_order_acquire);
1111
1112 LOCK(&task->lock);
1113 INSIST(task->state == task_state_ready);
1114 task->state = task_state_running;
1115 XTRACE("running");
1116 XTRACE(task->name);
1117 TIME_NOW(&task->tnow);
1118 task->now = isc_time_seconds(&task->tnow);
1119 do {
1120 if (!EMPTY(task->events)) {
1121 event = HEAD(task->events);
1122 DEQUEUE(task->events, event, ev_link);
1123 task->nevents--;
1124
1125 /*
1126 * Execute the event action.
1127 */
1128 XTRACE("execute action");
1129 XTRACE(task->name);
1130 if (event->ev_action != NULL) {
1131 UNLOCK(&task->lock);
1132 (event->ev_action)(
1133 (isc_task_t *)task,
1134 event);
1135 LOCK(&task->lock);
1136 }
1137 dispatch_count++;
1138 }
1139
1140 if (task->references == 0 &&
1141 EMPTY(task->events) &&
1142 !TASK_SHUTTINGDOWN(task)) {
1143 bool was_idle;
1144
1145 /*
1146 * There are no references and no
1147 * pending events for this task,
1148 * which means it will not become
1149 * runnable again via an external
1150 * action (such as sending an event
1151 * or detaching).
1152 *
1153 * We initiate shutdown to prevent
1154 * it from becoming a zombie.
1155 *
1156 * We do this here instead of in
1157 * the "if EMPTY(task->events)" block
1158 * below because:
1159 *
1160 * If we post no shutdown events,
1161 * we want the task to finish.
1162 *
1163 * If we did post shutdown events,
1164 * will still want the task's
1165 * quantum to be applied.
1166 */
1167 was_idle = task_shutdown(task);
1168 INSIST(!was_idle);
1169 }
1170
1171 if (EMPTY(task->events)) {
1172 /*
1173 * Nothing else to do for this task
1174 * right now.
1175 */
1176 XTRACE("empty");
1177 if (task->references == 0 &&
1178 TASK_SHUTTINGDOWN(task)) {
1179 /*
1180 * The task is done.
1181 */
1182 XTRACE("done");
1183 finished = true;
1184 task->state = task_state_done;
1185 } else
1186 task->state = task_state_idle;
1187 done = true;
1188 } else if (dispatch_count >= task->quantum) {
1189 /*
1190 * Our quantum has expired, but
1191 * there is more work to be done.
1192 * We'll requeue it to the ready
1193 * queue later.
1194 *
1195 * We don't check quantum until
1196 * dispatching at least one event,
1197 * so the minimum quantum is one.
1198 */
1199 XTRACE("quantum");
1200 task->state = task_state_ready;
1201 requeue = true;
1202 done = true;
1203 }
1204 } while (!done);
1205 UNLOCK(&task->lock);
1206
1207 if (finished)
1208 task_finished(task);
1209
1210 RUNTIME_CHECK(
1211 atomic_fetch_sub_explicit(&manager->tasks_running,
1212 1, memory_order_release) > 0);
1213 LOCK(&manager->queues[threadid].lock);
1214 if (requeue) {
1215 /*
1216 * We know we're awake, so we don't have
1217 * to wakeup any sleeping threads if the
1218 * ready queue is empty before we requeue.
1219 *
1220 * A possible optimization if the queue is
1221 * empty is to 'goto' the 'if (task != NULL)'
1222 * block, avoiding the ENQUEUE of the task
1223 * and the subsequent immediate DEQUEUE
1224 * (since it is the only executable task).
1225 * We don't do this because then we'd be
1226 * skipping the exit_requested check. The
1227 * cost of ENQUEUE is low anyway, especially
1228 * when you consider that we'd have to do
1229 * an extra EMPTY check to see if we could
1230 * do the optimization. If the ready queue
1231 * were usually nonempty, the 'optimization'
1232 * might even hurt rather than help.
1233 */
1234 push_readyq(manager, task, threadid);
1235 }
1236 }
1237
1238 /*
1239 * If we are in privileged execution mode and there are no
1240 * tasks remaining on the current ready queue, then
1241 * we're stuck. Automatically drop privileges at that
1242 * point and continue with the regular ready queue.
1243 */
1244 if (manager->mode != isc_taskmgrmode_normal &&
1245 atomic_load_explicit(&manager->tasks_running,
1246 memory_order_acquire) == 0)
1247 {
1248 UNLOCK(&manager->queues[threadid].lock);
1249 LOCK(&manager->lock);
1250 /*
1251 * Check once again, under lock. Mode can only
1252 * change from privileged to normal anyway, and
1253 * if we enter this loop twice at the same time
1254 * we'll end up in a deadlock over queue locks.
1255 *
1256 */
1257 if (manager->mode != isc_taskmgrmode_normal &&
1258 atomic_load_explicit(&manager->tasks_running,
1259 memory_order_acquire) == 0)
1260 {
1261 bool empty = true;
1262 unsigned int i;
1263 for (i = 0; i < manager->workers && empty; i++)
1264 {
1265 LOCK(&manager->queues[i].lock);
1266 empty &= empty_readyq(manager, i);
1267 UNLOCK(&manager->queues[i].lock);
1268 }
1269 if (empty) {
1270 atomic_store(&manager->mode,
1271 isc_taskmgrmode_normal);
1272 wake_all_queues(manager);
1273 }
1274 }
1275 UNLOCK(&manager->lock);
1276 LOCK(&manager->queues[threadid].lock);
1277 }
1278 }
1279 UNLOCK(&manager->queues[threadid].lock);
1280 /*
1281 * There might be other dispatchers waiting on empty tasks,
1282 * wake them up.
1283 */
1284 wake_all_queues(manager);
1285}
1286
1287static isc_threadresult_t
1288#ifdef _WIN32
1289WINAPI
1290#endif
1291run(void *queuep) {
1292 isc__taskqueue_t *tq = queuep;
1293 isc__taskmgr_t *manager = tq->manager;
1294 int threadid = tq->threadid;
1295 isc_thread_setaffinity(threadid);
1296
1297 XTHREADTRACE("starting");
1298
1299 dispatch(manager, threadid);
1300
1301 XTHREADTRACE("exiting");
1302
1303#ifdef OPENSSL_LEAKS
1304 ERR_remove_state(0);
1305#endif
1306
1307 return ((isc_threadresult_t)0);
1308}
1309
1310static void
1311manager_free(isc__taskmgr_t *manager) {
1312 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < manager->workers; i++) {
1313 isc_mutex_destroy(&manager->queues[i].lock);
1314 }
1315 isc_mutex_destroy(&manager->lock);
1316 isc_mutex_destroy(&manager->halt_lock);
1317 isc_mem_put(manager->mctx, manager->queues,
1318 manager->workers * sizeof(isc__taskqueue_t));
1319 manager->common.impmagic = 0;
1320 manager->common.magic = 0;
1321 isc_mem_putanddetach(&manager->mctx, manager, sizeof(*manager));
1322}
1323
1324isc_result_t
1325isc_taskmgr_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, unsigned int workers,
1326 unsigned int default_quantum, isc_taskmgr_t **managerp)
1327{
1328 unsigned int i;
1329 isc__taskmgr_t *manager;
1330
1331 /*
1332 * Create a new task manager.
1333 */
1334
1335 REQUIRE(workers > 0);
1336 REQUIRE(managerp != NULL && *managerp == NULL);
1337
1338 manager = isc_mem_get(mctx, sizeof(*manager));
1339 RUNTIME_CHECK(manager != NULL);
1340 manager->common.impmagic = TASK_MANAGER_MAGIC;
1341 manager->common.magic = ISCAPI_TASKMGR_MAGIC;
1342 atomic_store(&manager->mode, isc_taskmgrmode_normal);
1343 manager->mctx = NULL;
1344 isc_mutex_init(&manager->lock);
1345 isc_mutex_init(&manager->excl_lock);
1346
1347 isc_mutex_init(&manager->halt_lock);
1348 isc_condition_init(&manager->halt_cond);
1349
1350 manager->workers = workers;
1351
1352 if (default_quantum == 0) {
1353 default_quantum = DEFAULT_DEFAULT_QUANTUM;
1354 }
1355 manager->default_quantum = default_quantum;
1356 INIT_LIST(manager->tasks);
1357 atomic_store(&manager->tasks_count, 0);
1358 manager->queues = isc_mem_get(mctx, workers * sizeof(isc__taskqueue_t));
1359 RUNTIME_CHECK(manager->queues != NULL);
1360
1361 manager->tasks_running = 0;
1362 manager->tasks_ready = 0;
1363 manager->curq = 0;
1364 manager->exiting = false;
1365 manager->excl = NULL;
1366 manager->halted = 0;
1367 atomic_store_relaxed(&manager->exclusive_req, false);
1368 atomic_store_relaxed(&manager->pause_req, false);
1369
1370 isc_mem_attach(mctx, &manager->mctx);
1371
1372 LOCK(&manager->lock);
1373 /*
1374 * Start workers.
1375 */
1376 for (i = 0; i < workers; i++) {
1377 INIT_LIST(manager->queues[i].ready_tasks);
1378 INIT_LIST(manager->queues[i].ready_priority_tasks);
1379 isc_mutex_init(&manager->queues[i].lock);
1380 isc_condition_init(&manager->queues[i].work_available);
1381
1382 manager->queues[i].manager = manager;
1383 manager->queues[i].threadid = i;
1384 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_thread_create(run, &manager->queues[i],
1385 &manager->queues[i].thread)
1386 == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1387 char name[16];
1388 snprintf(name, sizeof(name), "isc-worker%04u", i);
1389 isc_thread_setname(manager->queues[i].thread, name);
1390 }
1391 UNLOCK(&manager->lock);
1392
1393 isc_thread_setconcurrency(workers);
1394
1395 *managerp = (isc_taskmgr_t *)manager;
1396
1397 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1398}
1399
1400void
1401isc_taskmgr_destroy(isc_taskmgr_t **managerp) {
1402 isc__taskmgr_t *manager;
1403 isc__task_t *task;
1404 unsigned int i;
1405 bool exiting;
1406
1407 /*
1408 * Destroy '*managerp'.
1409 */
1410
1411 REQUIRE(managerp != NULL);
1412 manager = (isc__taskmgr_t *)*managerp;
1413 REQUIRE(VALID_MANAGER(manager));
1414
1415 XTHREADTRACE("isc_taskmgr_destroy");
1416 /*
1417 * Only one non-worker thread may ever call this routine.
1418 * If a worker thread wants to initiate shutdown of the
1419 * task manager, it should ask some non-worker thread to call
1420 * isc_taskmgr_destroy(), e.g. by signalling a condition variable
1421 * that the startup thread is sleeping on.
1422 */
1423
1424 /*
1425 * Detach the exclusive task before acquiring the manager lock
1426 */
1427 LOCK(&manager->excl_lock);
1428 if (manager->excl != NULL)
1429 isc_task_detach((isc_task_t **) &manager->excl);
1430 UNLOCK(&manager->excl_lock);
1431
1432 /*
1433 * Unlike elsewhere, we're going to hold this lock a long time.
1434 * We need to do so, because otherwise the list of tasks could
1435 * change while we were traversing it.
1436 *
1437 * This is also the only function where we will hold both the
1438 * task manager lock and a task lock at the same time.
1439 */
1440
1441 LOCK(&manager->lock);
1442
1443 /*
1444 * Make sure we only get called once.
1445 */
1446 exiting = false;
1447
1448 INSIST(!!atomic_compare_exchange_strong(&manager->exiting,
1449 &exiting, true));
1450
1451 /*
1452 * If privileged mode was on, turn it off.
1453 */
1454 atomic_store(&manager->mode, isc_taskmgrmode_normal);
1455
1456 /*
1457 * Post shutdown event(s) to every task (if they haven't already been
1458 * posted). To make things easier post idle tasks to worker 0.
1459 */
1460 LOCK(&manager->queues[0].lock);
1461 for (task = HEAD(manager->tasks);
1462 task != NULL;
1463 task = NEXT(task, link)) {
1464 LOCK(&task->lock);
1465 if (task_shutdown(task)) {
1466 task->threadid = 0;
1467 push_readyq(manager, task, 0);
1468 }
1469 UNLOCK(&task->lock);
1470 }
1471 UNLOCK(&manager->queues[0].lock);
1472
1473 /*
1474 * Wake up any sleeping workers. This ensures we get work done if
1475 * there's work left to do, and if there are already no tasks left
1476 * it will cause the workers to see manager->exiting.
1477 */
1478 wake_all_queues(manager);
1479 UNLOCK(&manager->lock);
1480
1481 /*
1482 * Wait for all the worker threads to exit.
1483 */
1484 for (i = 0; i < manager->workers; i++)
1485 (void)isc_thread_join(manager->queues[i].thread, NULL);
1486
1487 manager_free(manager);
1488
1489 *managerp = NULL;
1490}
1491
1492void
1493isc_taskmgr_setprivilegedmode(isc_taskmgr_t *manager0) {
1494 isc__taskmgr_t *manager = (isc__taskmgr_t *)manager0;
1495
1496 atomic_store(&manager->mode, isc_taskmgrmode_privileged);
1497}
1498
1499isc_taskmgrmode_t
1500isc_taskmgr_mode(isc_taskmgr_t *manager0) {
1501 isc__taskmgr_t *manager = (isc__taskmgr_t *)manager0;
1502 return (atomic_load(&manager->mode));
1503}
1504
1505void
1506isc__taskmgr_pause(isc_taskmgr_t *manager0) {
1507 isc__taskmgr_t *manager = (isc__taskmgr_t *)manager0;
1508
1509 LOCK(&manager->halt_lock);
1510 while (atomic_load_relaxed(&manager->exclusive_req) ||
1511 atomic_load_relaxed(&manager->pause_req)) {
1512 UNLOCK(&manager->halt_lock);
1513 /* This is ugly but pause is used EXCLUSIVELY in tests */
1514 isc_thread_yield();
1515 LOCK(&manager->halt_lock);
1516 }
1517
1518 atomic_store_relaxed(&manager->pause_req, true);
1519 while (manager->halted < manager->workers) {
1520 wake_all_queues(manager);
1521 WAIT(&manager->halt_cond, &manager->halt_lock);
1522 }
1523 UNLOCK(&manager->halt_lock);
1524}
1525
1526void
1527isc__taskmgr_resume(isc_taskmgr_t *manager0) {
1528 isc__taskmgr_t *manager = (isc__taskmgr_t *)manager0;
1529 LOCK(&manager->halt_lock);
1530 if (manager->pause_req) {
1531 manager->pause_req = false;
1532 while (manager->halted > 0) {
1533 BROADCAST(&manager->halt_cond);
1534 WAIT(&manager->halt_cond, &manager->halt_lock);
1535 }
1536 }
1537 UNLOCK(&manager->halt_lock);
1538}
1539
1540void
1541isc_taskmgr_setexcltask(isc_taskmgr_t *mgr0, isc_task_t *task0) {
1542 isc__taskmgr_t *mgr = (isc__taskmgr_t *) mgr0;
1543 isc__task_t *task = (isc__task_t *) task0;
1544
1545 REQUIRE(VALID_MANAGER(mgr));
1546 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(task));
1547 LOCK(&mgr->excl_lock);
1548 if (mgr->excl != NULL)
1549 isc_task_detach((isc_task_t **) &mgr->excl);
1550 isc_task_attach(task0, (isc_task_t **) &mgr->excl);
1551 UNLOCK(&mgr->excl_lock);
1552}
1553
1554isc_result_t
1555isc_taskmgr_excltask(isc_taskmgr_t *mgr0, isc_task_t **taskp) {
1556 isc__taskmgr_t *mgr = (isc__taskmgr_t *) mgr0;
1557 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
1558
1559 REQUIRE(VALID_MANAGER(mgr));
1560 REQUIRE(taskp != NULL && *taskp == NULL);
1561
1562 LOCK(&mgr->excl_lock);
1563 if (mgr->excl != NULL)
1564 isc_task_attach((isc_task_t *) mgr->excl, taskp);
1565 else
1566 result = ISC_R_NOTFOUND;
1567 UNLOCK(&mgr->excl_lock);
1568
1569 return (result);
1570}
1571
1572isc_result_t
1573isc_task_beginexclusive(isc_task_t *task0) {
1574 isc__task_t *task = (isc__task_t *)task0;
1575 isc__taskmgr_t *manager = task->manager;
1576
1577 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(task));
1578
1579 REQUIRE(task->state == task_state_running);
1580
1581 LOCK(&manager->excl_lock);
1582 REQUIRE(task == task->manager->excl ||
1583 (atomic_load_relaxed(&task->manager->exiting) &&
1584 task->manager->excl == NULL));
1585 UNLOCK(&manager->excl_lock);
1586
1587 if (atomic_load_relaxed(&manager->exclusive_req) ||
1588 atomic_load_relaxed(&manager->pause_req)) {
1589 return (ISC_R_LOCKBUSY);
1590 }
1591
1592 LOCK(&manager->halt_lock);
1593 INSIST(!atomic_load_relaxed(&manager->exclusive_req) &&
1594 !atomic_load_relaxed(&manager->pause_req));
1595 atomic_store_relaxed(&manager->exclusive_req, true);
1596 while (manager->halted + 1 < manager->workers) {
1597 wake_all_queues(manager);
1598 WAIT(&manager->halt_cond, &manager->halt_lock);
1599 }
1600 UNLOCK(&manager->halt_lock);
1601 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1602}
1603
1604void
1605isc_task_endexclusive(isc_task_t *task0) {
1606 isc__task_t *task = (isc__task_t *)task0;
1607 isc__taskmgr_t *manager = task->manager;
1608
1609 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(task));
1610 REQUIRE(task->state == task_state_running);
1611 LOCK(&manager->halt_lock);
1612 REQUIRE(atomic_load_relaxed(&manager->exclusive_req) == true);
1613 atomic_store_relaxed(&manager->exclusive_req, false);
1614 while (manager->halted > 0) {
1615 BROADCAST(&manager->halt_cond);
1616 WAIT(&manager->halt_cond, &manager->halt_lock);
1617 }
1618 UNLOCK(&manager->halt_lock);
1619}
1620
1621void
1622isc_task_setprivilege(isc_task_t *task0, bool priv) {
1623 REQUIRE(ISCAPI_TASK_VALID(task0));
1624 isc__task_t *task = (isc__task_t *)task0;
1625 isc__taskmgr_t *manager = task->manager;
1626 bool oldpriv;
1627
1628 LOCK(&task->lock);
1629 oldpriv = ((task->flags & TASK_F_PRIVILEGED) != 0);
1630 if (priv)
1631 task->flags |= TASK_F_PRIVILEGED;
1632 else
1633 task->flags &= ~TASK_F_PRIVILEGED;
1634 UNLOCK(&task->lock);
1635
1636 if (priv == oldpriv)
1637 return;
1638
1639 LOCK(&manager->queues[task->threadid].lock);
1640 if (priv && ISC_LINK_LINKED(task, ready_link))
1641 ENQUEUE(manager->queues[task->threadid].ready_priority_tasks,
1642 task, ready_priority_link);
1643 else if (!priv && ISC_LINK_LINKED(task, ready_priority_link))
1644 DEQUEUE(manager->queues[task->threadid].ready_priority_tasks,
1645 task, ready_priority_link);
1646 UNLOCK(&manager->queues[task->threadid].lock);
1647}
1648
1649bool
1650isc_task_privilege(isc_task_t *task0) {
1651 isc__task_t *task = (isc__task_t *)task0;
1652 bool priv;
1653 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(task));
1654
1655 LOCK(&task->lock);
1656 priv = ((task->flags & TASK_F_PRIVILEGED) != 0);
1657 UNLOCK(&task->lock);
1658 return (priv);
1659}
1660
1661bool
1662isc_task_exiting(isc_task_t *t) {
1663 isc__task_t *task = (isc__task_t *)t;
1664
1665 REQUIRE(VALID_TASK(task));
1666 return (TASK_SHUTTINGDOWN(task));
1667}
1668
1669
1670#ifdef HAVE_LIBXML2
1671#define TRY0(a) do { xmlrc = (a); if (xmlrc < 0) goto error; } while(/*CONSTCOND*/0)
1672int
1673isc_taskmgr_renderxml(isc_taskmgr_t *mgr0, xmlTextWriterPtr writer) {
1674 isc__taskmgr_t *mgr = (isc__taskmgr_t *)mgr0;
1675 isc__task_t *task = NULL;
1676 int xmlrc;
1677
1678 LOCK(&mgr->lock);
1679
1680 /*
1681 * Write out the thread-model, and some details about each depending
1682 * on which type is enabled.
1683 */
1684 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer, ISC_XMLCHAR "thread-model"));
1685 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer, ISC_XMLCHAR "type"));
1686 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteString(writer, ISC_XMLCHAR "threaded"));
1687 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer)); /* type */
1688
1689 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer, ISC_XMLCHAR "worker-threads"));
1690 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteFormatString(writer, "%d", mgr->workers));
1691 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer)); /* worker-threads */
1692
1693 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer, ISC_XMLCHAR "default-quantum"));
1694 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteFormatString(writer, "%d",
1695 mgr->default_quantum));
1696 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer)); /* default-quantum */
1697
1698 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer, ISC_XMLCHAR "tasks-count"));
1699 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteFormatString(writer, "%d",
1700 (int) atomic_load_relaxed(&mgr->tasks_count)));
1701 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer)); /* tasks-count */
1702
1703 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer, ISC_XMLCHAR "tasks-running"));
1704 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteFormatString(writer, "%d",
1705 (int) atomic_load_relaxed(&mgr->tasks_running)));
1706 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer)); /* tasks-running */
1707
1708 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer, ISC_XMLCHAR "tasks-ready"));
1709 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteFormatString(writer, "%d",
1710 (int) atomic_load_relaxed(&mgr->tasks_ready)));
1711 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer)); /* tasks-ready */
1712
1713 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer)); /* thread-model */
1714
1715 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer, ISC_XMLCHAR "tasks"));
1716 task = ISC_LIST_HEAD(mgr->tasks);
1717 while (task != NULL) {
1718 LOCK(&task->lock);
1719 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer, ISC_XMLCHAR "task"));
1720
1721 if (task->name[0] != 0) {
1722 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer,
1723 ISC_XMLCHAR "name"));
1724 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteFormatString(writer, "%s",
1725 task->name));
1726 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer)); /* name */
1727 }
1728
1729 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer,
1730 ISC_XMLCHAR "references"));
1731 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteFormatString(writer, "%d",
1732 task->references));
1733 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer)); /* references */
1734
1735 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer, ISC_XMLCHAR "id"));
1736 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteFormatString(writer, "%p", task));
1737 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer)); /* id */
1738
1739 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer, ISC_XMLCHAR "state"));
1740 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteFormatString(writer, "%s",
1741 statenames[task->state]));
1742 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer)); /* state */
1743
1744 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer, ISC_XMLCHAR "quantum"));
1745 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteFormatString(writer, "%d",
1746 task->quantum));
1747 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer)); /* quantum */
1748
1749 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer, ISC_XMLCHAR "events"));
1750 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteFormatString(writer, "%d",
1751 task->nevents));
1752 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer)); /* events */
1753
1754 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer));
1755
1756 UNLOCK(&task->lock);
1757 task = ISC_LIST_NEXT(task, link);
1758 }
1759 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer)); /* tasks */
1760
1761 error:
1762 if (task != NULL)
1763 UNLOCK(&task->lock);
1764 UNLOCK(&mgr->lock);
1765
1766 return (xmlrc);
1767}
1768#endif /* HAVE_LIBXML2 */
1769
1770#ifdef HAVE_JSON
1771#define CHECKMEM(m) do { \
1772 if (m == NULL) { \
1773 result = ISC_R_NOMEMORY;\
1774 goto error;\
1775 } \
1776} while(/*CONSTCOND*/0)
1777
1778isc_result_t
1779isc_taskmgr_renderjson(isc_taskmgr_t *mgr0, json_object *tasks) {
1780 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
1781 isc__taskmgr_t *mgr = (isc__taskmgr_t *)mgr0;
1782 isc__task_t *task = NULL;
1783 json_object *obj = NULL, *array = NULL, *taskobj = NULL;
1784
1785 LOCK(&mgr->lock);
1786
1787 /*
1788 * Write out the thread-model, and some details about each depending
1789 * on which type is enabled.
1790 */
1791 obj = json_object_new_string("threaded");
1792 CHECKMEM(obj);
1793 json_object_object_add(tasks, "thread-model", obj);
1794
1795 obj = json_object_new_int(mgr->workers);
1796 CHECKMEM(obj);
1797 json_object_object_add(tasks, "worker-threads", obj);
1798
1799 obj = json_object_new_int(mgr->default_quantum);
1800 CHECKMEM(obj);
1801 json_object_object_add(tasks, "default-quantum", obj);
1802
1803 obj = json_object_new_int(atomic_load_relaxed(&mgr->tasks_count));
1804 CHECKMEM(obj);
1805 json_object_object_add(tasks, "tasks-count", obj);
1806
1807 obj = json_object_new_int(atomic_load_relaxed(&mgr->tasks_running));
1808 CHECKMEM(obj);
1809 json_object_object_add(tasks, "tasks-running", obj);
1810
1811 obj = json_object_new_int(atomic_load_relaxed(&mgr->tasks_ready));
1812 CHECKMEM(obj);
1813 json_object_object_add(tasks, "tasks-ready", obj);
1814
1815 array = json_object_new_array();
1816 CHECKMEM(array);
1817
1818 for (task = ISC_LIST_HEAD(mgr->tasks);
1819 task != NULL;
1820 task = ISC_LIST_NEXT(task, link))
1821 {
1822 char buf[255];
1823
1824 LOCK(&task->lock);
1825
1826 taskobj = json_object_new_object();
1827 CHECKMEM(taskobj);
1828 json_object_array_add(array, taskobj);
1829
1830 snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "%p", task);
1831 obj = json_object_new_string(buf);
1832 CHECKMEM(obj);
1833 json_object_object_add(taskobj, "id", obj);
1834
1835 if (task->name[0] != 0) {
1836 obj = json_object_new_string(task->name);
1837 CHECKMEM(obj);
1838 json_object_object_add(taskobj, "name", obj);
1839 }
1840
1841 obj = json_object_new_int(task->references);
1842 CHECKMEM(obj);
1843 json_object_object_add(taskobj, "references", obj);
1844
1845 obj = json_object_new_string(statenames[task->state]);
1846 CHECKMEM(obj);
1847 json_object_object_add(taskobj, "state", obj);
1848
1849 obj = json_object_new_int(task->quantum);
1850 CHECKMEM(obj);
1851 json_object_object_add(taskobj, "quantum", obj);
1852
1853 obj = json_object_new_int(task->nevents);
1854 CHECKMEM(obj);
1855 json_object_object_add(taskobj, "events", obj);
1856
1857 UNLOCK(&task->lock);
1858 }
1859
1860 json_object_object_add(tasks, "tasks", array);
1861 array = NULL;
1862 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
1863
1864 error:
1865 if (array != NULL)
1866 json_object_put(array);
1867
1868 if (task != NULL)
1869 UNLOCK(&task->lock);
1870 UNLOCK(&mgr->lock);
1871
1872 return (result);
1873}
1874#endif
1875
1876
1877isc_result_t
1878isc_taskmgr_createinctx(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_appctx_t *actx,
1879 unsigned int workers, unsigned int default_quantum,
1880 isc_taskmgr_t **managerp)
1881{
1882 isc_result_t result;
1883
1884 result = isc_taskmgr_create(mctx, workers, default_quantum,
1885 managerp);
1886
1887 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1888 isc_appctx_settaskmgr(actx, *managerp);
1889
1890 return (result);
1891}
